titleInfo.title: 'File 4/37 Kuwait State. Employment of Personal Bodyguard by Sheikh'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence for this description commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 14; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-13; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence between British officials regarding the desire of the Ruler of Kuwait, Shaikh Ahmad al-Jaber al-Sabah, to employ a personal bodyguard force comprised of Pakistani nationals.The British authorities were supportive of the idea and this is expressed in a number of messages exchanged between the Political Agency in Kuwait and other British officials in the region and in Pakistan.The file also contains a list of the terms of employment for the Pakistani nationals being considered for hire that was sent from the Pakistani Ministry of Foreign Affairs to the Persian Gulf Residency in Bahrain (folios 10-11).
